plugins.name: Superduper Maps
plugins.description:
Superduper Maps brings real, interactive maps directly into your Figma designs. No more static screenshots or placeholder rectangles‚Äîinsert dynamic, customizable maps with a single click. Pan, zoom, and explore in real-time, then export crisp, production-ready maps at any resolution. With 3D camera controls, custom styling options, and frame-perfect sizing, you can create stunning location-based designs that match your exact vision.


Core Features


üó∫Ô∏è Interactive Map Preview

  1. Live canvas with real-time pan and zoom
  2. Smooth, responsive map exploration before inserting
  3. Instant visual feedback for all adjustments


üìç Precision Location Control

  1. Search any location worldwide with integrated geocoding
  2. Fine-tune latitude, longitude, and zoom levels
  3. One-click reset to default view


üé® Professional Map Styles

  1. Access to 8+ premium map themes (Streets, Outdoors, Light, Dark, Satellite, Navigation)
  2. Import and save custom styles for brand consistency
  3. Real-time style switching and preview


üìê Advanced Camera Controls

  1. 3D perspective with adjustable bearing (0-360¬∞) and tilt (0-60¬∞)
  2. Create dramatic map angles and cinematic views
  3. Perfect for hero sections and showcase designs


‚ö° Smart Frame Integration

  1. Automatically detects selected Figma frames
  2. Maps adapt perfectly to your frame dimensions
  3. Frame-perfect sizing every time


üñºÔ∏è High-Quality Export

  1. Export at 1x for web or 2x for retina displays
  2. Up to 4000x4000px export capability
  3. Consistent geographic coverage that matches preview


üöÄ Performance Optimised

  1. Intelligent tile caching for faster loading
  2. Offline support for previously viewed areas
  3. Built specifically for Figma's architecture


Superduper Maps Pro

  1. 50 daily exports (vs 5 lifetime on free tier)
  2. Unlimited usage with your own Mapbox API key
  3. Cancel anytime - no long-term commitments


Coming Soon

  1. Google Maps integration
  2. OpenStreetMap support
plugins.tagline: Maps for Figma, super fast, super good

plugins.name: Contrast Checker Pro
plugins.description:
üé® Advanced Contrast Checker


üé® Advanced Contrast Checker ‚Äì Smart Contrast Analysis for Accessible Design


Take your design‚Äôs accessibility to the next level.


Advanced Contrast Checker: is a plugin built to detect and analyze contrast issues, even in complex scenarios like elements with **image backgrounds**.


üß† Key Features:


1. üéØ Accurate Detection


  1. Automatically identifies when an element has an **image as a background.
  2. Checks the layer hierarchy, scanning parent elements if necessary.


2. üì¢ Clear and Visual Feedback


  1. Displays a prominent message when an image background is detected.
  2. Indicates that the contrast ratio is an approximation, offering a helpful reference.
  3. Includes visual icons for better clarity and user understanding.


3. üåç Multilingual Support


  1. Available in English, Spanish, and Chinese.
  2. Automatically switches language based on your Figma settings.


4. ü§ñ Intelligent Behavior


  1. No color suggestions are shown when the background is an image.
  2. Uses a light gray approximation** to estimate contrast without misleading results.



Designed for creators who care about building **visually inclusive and accessible interfaces**, without compromising on precision or speed.


With üé® Advanced Contrast Checker accessibility becomes a natural part of your design workflow.
plugins.tagline: Smart contrast checking, even with image backgrounds.

plugins.name: Component State Mapper
plugins.description:
Tired of getting lost in complex component variants? Struggling to track every possible state, prevent design inconsistencies, and explain component logic to your team?


Introducing State Mapper, the essential Figma plugin that transforms your complex component sets into clear, interactive, and easy-to-understand visual maps. Stop navigating your variants blindfolded and gain a bird's-eye view of your entire component architecture.


With a single click, State Mapper instantly generates a live flowchart of all your variants, showing you exactly how they connect and what properties change between them.


Key Features:


  2. üó∫Ô∏è Instant Visual Mapping: Automatically generate beautiful, easy-to-read diagrams from any component set. See the full picture, from simple buttons to complex data tables.
  3. üî¨ Powerful Filtering & Layouts: Is your map too complex? No problem. Isolate exactly what you need by filtering properties and values. Switch between Hierarchical, Graph, and Matrix layouts to find the perfect view.
  4. ‚ö†Ô∏è Smart "Missing State" Detection: Our most powerful feature! State Mapper intelligently analyzes your component's properties and automatically flags potential "holes" or missing variants in your system, helping you prevent bugs before they happen.
  5. ü§ù Seamless Handoff & Documentation: Export your component maps as SVG or PNG to include them directly in your documentation on Confluence, Notion, or Jira. Make sure developers understand the logic perfectly.
  6. üîÑ Live Sync: Keep your map updated in real-time. As you add, remove, or change variants, your map reflects those changes instantly.

Who is it for?


State Mapper is built for meticulous Product Designers, UI/UX Designers, and Design System teams who want to build more robust, error-free, and well-documented components.


Install State Mapper today and bring order, clarity, and intelligence to your design system!

accepted.name: 0mid madah
accepted.description: Product Designer by trade, problem-solver by nature. I build bridges between human needs and digital solutions, one pixel at a time.

plugins.tagline: Bring clarity to component chaos.

plugins.name: adamantium token lab - analyze, organize & export tokens
plugins.description:
adamantium token lab

Your ultimate Figma Variables exporter & manager to rule your tokens.


Stop manually transcribing design tokens! adamantium token lab bridges the gap between your Figma Variables and your codebase, streamlining your design-to-development workflow with unparalleled power and flexibility.


Whether you're working with a simple project or a complex multi-library design system, adamantium token lab gives you the tools to view, manage, analyze, and export your design tokens exactly how you need them. Say goodbye to errors, inconsistencies, and wasted time.


Why You Need adamantium token lab:

  1. Bridge the Design-Dev Gap: Seamlessly translate your Figma Variables into production-ready code.
  2. Ensure Consistency: Maintain a single source of truth for your design tokens across all projects.
  3. Boost Efficiency: Automate token exports, saving hours and reducing manual errors.
  4. Unmatched Customization: Tailor token output to perfectly match your team's coding standards.
  5. Maintain a Clean Design System: Understand token usage, identify unused variables, and keep your system tidy.
  6. Empower Collaboration: Provide developers with exactly what they need, in their preferred format.
  7. Handle Complexity with Ease: Advanced features like comprehensive library alias resolution simplify managing large-scale design systems.



Core Features:

Token Viewing & Management:

  1. View all Figma Variables (colors, numbers, strings, booleans) in a dynamic, resizable table.
  2. See token names, descriptions, types, and values per mode at a glance.
  3. Toggle in-table alias resolution to see actual values directly.
  4. Customize the display format for color values (HEX, RGBA, HSLA, etc.) in the table.
  5. Easily filter and view tokens from specific collections.


Powerful & Highly Customizable Export Engine:

  1. Export to CSS Custom Properties.
  2. Export to SASS Variables ($var).
  3. Export to SASS Maps (Nested or Flat options available).
  4. Export to JSON (Structured or Nested, with options for flat key paths).
  5. Export a developer-friendly Intermediate Representation (IR) for custom workflows.
  6. Apply naming conventions: camelCase, PascalCase, kebab-case, snake_case, and more.
  7. Add custom prefixes and suffixes to token names or filenames.
  8. Define custom path separators for token names (e.g., -, _, .).
  9. Output colors in various formats: HEX, HEX8, RGB(A), HSL(A), HSB(A).
  10. Configure numeric units (px, rem, em, pt) and base font size for rem/em.
  11. Choose your alias strategy: embed resolved values or reference original variables/map keys.
  12. Optionally include collection and mode names in exported variable names.
  13. Include token descriptions as comments in your exported code.
  14. Output JSON color values as strings or structured objects.
  15. Customize CSS mode selector templates (e.g., :root[data-theme="$MODE"]).
  16. See an instant live preview of your export with syntax highlighting.
  17. Download generated token files easily.


Advanced Token Usage Analysis:

  1. Identify which design tokens are actively used in your Figma designs.
  2. Analyze token usage on the "Current Page" or across the "Entire File".
  3. View a "Used" column in the token table for clear visual indicators.
  4. See updated collection counts showing (used / total) tokens after analysis.
  5. View a prominent banner confirming the scope and results of the last analysis.
  6. Filter the token list to show "All," "Used," or "Unused" tokens.


Deep Library Integration (All Features Currently Enabled):

  1. Effortlessly work with variables from your enabled Figma libraries.
  2. See clear indicators for the source library of your collections, including the library name where available.
  3. Includes powerful, deep alias resolution across external libraries ‚Äì essential for complex design systems, ensuring your exported values are always accurate.
  4. The UI intuitively displays information about library-linked aliases with distinct styling, providing full clarity in your token management.


Get Started with adamantium token lab Today!

Take control of your design tokens, accelerate your development process, and ensure unparalleled consistency across your projects. Install adamantium token lab and transform your Figma Variables workflow!



üå± This is a Beta Version!

adamantium token lab is currently in active development and is being released as a Beta version. This means that while we've worked hard to make it powerful and stable, you might encounter occasional bugs or quirks.


Your Feedback is Gold! ü™ô

We are incredibly passionate about making adamantium token lab the best token management tool for you, and your experience and insights are crucial to this journey. As you use the plugin, please help us improve by:


  1. Reporting any bugs or issues you encounter.
  2. Sharing your feature requests and ideas for new functionality.
  3. Letting us know what you love and what could be even better.


Your feedback will directly shape the future of adamantium token lab, helping us to squash bugs, refine features, and build the ultimate token workflow tool. We're committed to regular updates and improvements based on your input.
plugins.tagline: analyze, organize, name, export, cleanup. One token lab to rule your tokens (figma variables).

Bulk Renamer 2.0


A powerful, user-friendly tool for renaming multiple frames or components in one go.


Bulk Renamer 2.0 lets you paste a list of names (typed manually, copied from Excel, or generated elsewhere) and instantly apply them to your selected frames ‚Äî in the exact order and direction you choose.


‚∏ª


‚ú® Features:

‚Ä¢Rename frames by typing or pasting names

‚Ä¢Smart support for Excel/Sheets cell pastes

‚Ä¢Auto-adds commas only when you press Enter

‚Ä¢Supports left-to-right or top-to-bottom frame direction

‚Ä¢Real-time validation for name count vs frame selection

‚Ä¢Clean, dark-themed UI with live feedback


‚∏ª


ü™Ñ How to use:

1.Select your frames/components in Figma

2.Choose your naming direction

3.Paste or type names (one per line)

4.Click Apply to rename all selected items

plugins.name: Mode Match
plugins.description:
Mode Match lets you take a variable's value from one mode and apply it to other modes. Match a single variable, group of variables, or all variables in a collection!


  1. Select your multi-mode collection
  2. Select the source mode (copy from)
  3. Select the destination mode (copy to)
  4. Enter the path to a group of variables or a single variable (see below for bulk actions)
  5. Update ‚ú®


Tip

  1. Keep your variable window open to see the changes.
  2. Use the Refresh button to pull in changes to the variables made when the plugin window is open. (see below for copy & paste)
  3. Use clear to quickly delete the path.


Bulk Actions

You will most likely want to run this on a group or the entire collection:

  1. Update all variables within a group by entering a path/to/group
  2. Update all variables in the collection by entering / @all or @root in the path input


Plugin Notes

  1. Collection list will only show collections with more than 1 mode
  2. Variable names and paths are case sensitive
  3. Updating variables, especially those linked to text styles may take longer to propagate


Supports

  1. All variable types (number, string, boolean, color)
  2. Aliasing
  3. Raw values


Copy/Paste Figma Bug

If you copy/paste variables between collections, you may need to reload the tab in order for those variables to register in their new collection.

accepted.name: Murph
accepted.description: Systems Designer ‚Ä¢ Plugin Author ‚Ä¢ Rectangle Lover

plugins.name: Synchronize Frames
plugins.description:
This program enhances efficiency in Figma by allowing users to synchronize frames automatically. It ensures that any modifications made to a selected frame are instantly reflected in all corresponding frames, promoting consistency across designs. The user interface features intuitive buttons to assign frames, toggle synchronization, and activate auto-sync capabilities.


To automatically search for frames for synchronization, the "SS_" tag must be specified before the frame name.

plugins.name: QuickToken
plugins.description:
QuickToken is the Figma plugin that enables instant variable import and seamless organization. Designed for designers who prioritize efficiency, QuickToken allows you to quickly insert variables into Figma‚Äôs local variables as design tokens. It supports collections and groups, keeping all variables clear and organized. Simplify your variable management and speed up your workflow with this powerful, efficient plugin!


Supported name schemes:


Create Variable Collection

#Collection


Create Variable Group

Group/


Create Variable

variable-name: value


The variable type recognition is automatically

based on the variable value itself.


Supported variable types


  1. Float 30
  2. Colors #333, #334455, rgb(0,100,100), rgba(2,2,2,0.1)
  3. Boolean: true, false
  4. String: 'Hello'
  5. Variable link: var(variable-name)

plugins.name: Find All My Fonts
plugins.description:
Find My Fonts provides a detailed and structured report of all fonts used in your Figma design.

  1. Get a complete overview of all fonts used in your file
  2. Detect unaccounted or hidden fonts across pages and frames
  3. Find repeated text names that may indicate duplicates
  4. Identify fonts inside hidden layers, components, and instances
  5. Choose between analyzing the current page, all pages, or selected frames
  6. Filter by text-only layers, hidden content, or component structure
  7. Group results by font family, font size, or duplicate names
  8. Select matching layers directly from the report
  9. Export the full font usage report to PDF for further review or documentation

The plugin supports 9 languages and has a clean interface with light and dark theme.
plugins.tagline: fonts, report, text layers, hidden text, duplicates, components, pdf export, fontfamily, fontstyle

Use Cases

plugins.name: Inked Colibri (RTC Converter and More)
plugins.description:
"Enhance your design workflow with a powerful plugin that converts Realtime Colors into Figma variables. Generate stunning color schemes, manage variables, and ensure contrast compliance with APCA standards. Features include interactive color pairing visualization, CSS variable export, and seamless theme synchronization."

https://youtu.be/H7M28NFhJ14


Core Features


Color Scheme Management

  1. Generate color schemes: monochromatic, analogous, complementary, and more.
  2. Randomize colors with support for multiple schemes.
  3. Enable real-time color updates and synchronization.
  4. Perform APCA contrast calculations and validation.


Matrix Generation

  1. Generate three matrix types: huge, compact, and slim.
  2. Create alpha-based color matrices.
  3. Visualize APCA contrast and validate thresholds.
  4. Customize thresholds and interactively visualize color pairings.


Variable Management

  1. Create and update color variables.
  2. Convert styles bi-directionally.
  3. Export variables as CSS.
  4. Generate and visualize swatches.
  5. Synchronize themes seamlessly.
plugins.tagline: Convert Realtime Colors to Variables, ensure APCA Accessibility, generate schemes, and more!
